TITLE: ‘Based on a True Story’ (Except the Parts That Aren’t)
SUMMARY: The entertainment genre of historical drama is flourishing — and riddled with inaccuracies. The untrue parts are leading to more public spats and lawsuits.

TITLE: U.S. Will Hit Debt Limit on Thursday, Yellen Tells Congress
SUMMARY: The Treasury Department expects to begin taking “extraordinary measures” to continue paying the government’s obligations before what is expected to be a big fight to raise the borrowing cap.

TITLE: How to Ask for a Raise, Without Alienating Your Boss Along the Way
SUMMARY: Tips from psychologists, managers and people who have successfully asked what can feel like a very difficult question.

TITLE: Who Benefits When Salary Info Is Public?
SUMMARY: It’s good for pay equity, and it can be good for managers, but it’s not so good for superstars.

TITLE: Just How Common Is Corporate Fraud?
SUMMARY: A new study estimates that on average 10 percent of public companies commit securities fraud each year.

TITLE: Medicare Begins to Rein In Drug Costs for Older Americans
SUMMARY: Reforms embedded in the Inflation Reduction Act will bring savings to seniors this year. Already some lawmakers are aiming to repeal the changes.

TITLE: Cooperation on Climate Is Emerging in the Middle East
SUMMARY: After the Abraham Accords, partnerships between companies in Israel and Arab countries have led to the kinds of initiatives that will be on the Davos agenda.

TITLE: When Black Characters Double-Deal to Make Ends Meet, It’s Never Enough
SUMMARY: In three Broadway plays this season, a quest for financial stability can’t undo the trauma of the past or dismantle the architecture that places a ceiling on Black futures.

TITLE: Davos Is a Winter Haven, Even With the Crowds
SUMMARY: Many tourist spots are shut down or blocked off during the World Economic Forum, yet there’s still plenty to do amid the clear air and mountain vistas.

TITLE: A United Europe Weathers Crises, but Deeper Challenges Remain
SUMMARY: Differences on NATO and E.U. enlargement, energy and climate, and relationships with the United States, China, Russia and Ukraine will prime Davos talks.

TITLE: World Economic Forum in Davos Confronts a New Order
SUMMARY: The Covid-19 pandemic, invasion of Ukraine, trend toward autocracy and economic inequalities challenge the World Economic Forum’s relevance.

TITLE: The War in Ukraine Upended Energy Markets. What Does That Mean for the Climate?
SUMMARY: Almost a year after Russia launched its invasion, assessing the impact on the oil industry and greenhouse gas goals is not so simple.

TITLE: As Humanitarian Crises Escalate, So Do Demands to End Them
SUMMARY: David Miliband, head of the International Rescue Committee, says the global refugee crisis “is manageable, not insoluble.”

TITLE: No Increased Stroke Risk Linked to Pfizer’s Covid Boosters, Federal Officials Say
SUMMARY: An uptick hinted at in surveillance data was a mirage, the officials said.

TITLE: Investors Are Walking a Tightrope as Stocks Rise for a Second Week
SUMMARY: Signs of slowing inflation are competing with downbeat company forecasts as earnings season begins.

TITLE: 27 People on the Streets of New York Talk About How Much Money They Make
SUMMARY: We asked nearly 400 people to tell us how much they earn. Here are two dozen who actually spoke to us.

TITLE: Bob Jordan, Southwest Airlines’ CEO, on What Went Wrong
SUMMARY: Southwest Airlines’ chief executive, Bob Jordan, said frigid temperatures and mistakes by the company caused its meltdown around Christmas.

TITLE: Tesla Cuts Prices Sharply as It Moves to Bolster Demand
SUMMARY: The price reductions in the United States will make more of the company’s electric vehicles eligible for a federal tax credit.

TITLE: Your Tax Refunds May Be Smaller This Year
SUMMARY: Credits that were expanded as part of pandemic relief have expired, as has the deduction for donations for people who don’t itemize.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs’ Marcus Consumer Banking Move Turns Costly
SUMMARY: Goldman Sachs will take a big hit from its ill-fated move into consumer banking, even as its other businesses weaken amid an economic slowdown.

TITLE: Sweden Says It Has Uncovered a Rare Earth Bonanza
SUMMARY: A state-owned mining company announced it had found Europe’s largest deposit of the vital minerals used in electric vehicles and other green technology.

TITLE: Remains of Florida Woman Missing Since Hurricane Ian Are Found
SUMMARY: The woman, Ilonka Knes, 82, was among the 146 people in Florida who died in the September storm, the state’s deadliest since 1935.

TITLE: Bed Bath & Beyond in Talks to Sell Assets
SUMMARY: The beleaguered retailer, which has warned of a possible bankruptcy, is said to be in discussions with suitors about selling pieces of its business, including its Buy Buy Baby stores.

TITLE: JPMorgan Sets Aside Money for Bad Debts as ‘Mild Recession’ Looms
SUMMARY: The bank, the biggest in the United States, reported a large profit in its latest quarter, but said it was girding for a downturn later in the year.

TITLE: Big Banks Set Aside Billions as They Brace for a Downturn
SUMMARY: The country’s largest lenders increased their reserves to protect against deteriorating economic conditions this year, after reporting resilient profits for the end of last year.

TITLE: The SEC’s Crypto Crackdown Intensifies
SUMMARY: The agency has charged the crypto trading firms Genesis Global Capital and Gemini with operating an illegal lending service that lost customers millions.

TITLE: Barry Diller Explores Sale of The Daily Beast
SUMMARY: The tech mogul’s company has hired Whisper Advisors, an advisory firm, to find potential buyers for the digital publication.

TITLE: Why Is It So Hard to Talk About Salary, Especially at Work?
SUMMARY: The merits of talking candidly about salary are widely acknowledged. Actually doing it is more complicated.

TITLE: Investing When Your Time Horizon Is Short
SUMMARY: Cut back on stock and bond holdings, and focus on money market funds, C.D.s, Treasury bills and other options that are now offering high yields, our columnist says.

TITLE: Scott Minerd, a Force, and a Voice, on Wall Street, Dies at 63
SUMMARY: He helped turn Guggenheim Partners into a global investing giant. He was also a CNBC and Bloomberg commentator and a philanthropist for human rights.

TITLE: I.M.F. Sees World Economy Rebounding, Yet Still Fragile, in 2023
SUMMARY: Kristalina Georgieva, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, predicts that a global recession can be avoided.

TITLE: Democratic Senators Press Southwest Over Its Christmas Meltdown
SUMMARY: A group of lawmakers sent a letter to the airline’s chief executive seeking information about the widespread disruptions that stranded travelers last month.

TITLE: SEC Charges Crypto Companies With Offering Unregistered Securities
SUMMARY: The S.E.C. charged Genesis Global Capital and Gemini Trust, which is run by Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, as crypto companies face heightened regulatory scrutiny.

TITLE: U.S. Deficit Fell to $1.4 Trillion in 2022
SUMMARY: The deficit was down from $2.6 trillion a year earlier, as pandemic emergency spending slowed, the economy reopened and tax revenue rose. The new figures come as spending fights loom in a divided Congress.

TITLE: Don’t Ban ChatGPT in Schools. Teach With It.
SUMMARY: OpenAI’s new chatbot is raising fears of cheating on homework, but its potential as an educational tool outweighs its risks.

TITLE: Virgin Orbit Offers More Details on Rocket Failure
SUMMARY: More than 110 miles above earth, the rocket’s second-stage engine prematurely shut down before entering orbit, causing the loss of nine satellites.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried, Founder of FTX, Responds to Fraud Charges
SUMMARY: The disgraced founder of the crypto exchange FTX denied that he stole anyone’s money and said customers could still get their deposits back.

TITLE: Disney Prepares for a Board Fight by Nelson Peltz
SUMMARY: After months of talks, the activist investor Nelson Peltz is jockeying for a director position at the entertainment giant as he pushes for a series of changes.

TITLE: Nurses’ Strike Ends in New York City After Hospitals Agree to Add Nurses
SUMMARY: Nurses at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx and Mount Sinai in Manhattan will return to work after the hospitals agreed to add staffing and improve working conditions.

TITLE: Why China Is Changing Its Tone on Business
SUMMARY: With the economy in a fragile state, Chinese officials are starting to use more business-friendly language, and also to back their words with action.

TITLE: Inflation Is Slowing, Good News for American Consumers and the Fed
SUMMARY: Consumer Price Index inflation moderated to 6.5 percent in December, helping Fed officials to lean toward slower rate moves.

TITLE: Uber Drivers Say They Are Struggling: ‘This Is Not Sustainable’
SUMMARY: Drivers’ hourly earnings have increased since 2018, but the company sued to block their raise last year and inflation has taken a toll.

TITLE: Investors Look to Corporate Reports With Low Expectations
SUMMARY: As companies prepare to publish their latest financial results, Wall Street forecasters expect profits to fall for the first time since the early days of the pandemic.

TITLE: Amazon Loses Bid to Overturn Union Victory at Staten Island Warehouse
SUMMARY: A National Labor Relations Board official found a lack of evidence to support claims of election improprieties. Amazon could appeal the decision.

TITLE: Disney Pushes Back Against Nelson Peltz’s Quest for Board Seat
SUMMARY: Nelson Peltz wants the company to revamp its streaming business and focus on increasing profits. Disney wants shareholders to vote against his effort to get a seat on the board.

TITLE: FAA Outage Highlights Fragility of the Aviation System
SUMMARY: The Federal Aviation Administration halted flights Wednesday morning after a system to alert pilots to safety issues went down, just two weeks after a major Southwest Airlines meltdown.

TITLE: 2023 Golden Globes Viewership Was the Lowest for NBC Since 1996
SUMMARY: Tuesday’s viewership, of 6.3 million, was the lowest since NBC started broadcasting the awards show in 1996.

TITLE: Kyiv Workers Find Their Way Online Even as Ukraine Faces Power Outages
SUMMARY: Sporadic power outages have people resorting to makeshift office spaces in the Ukrainian capital. Stores have set up power hubs, and workers are getting comfortable doing their jobs in home furnishing displays.

TITLE: Why Hitting the Debt Ceiling Would Be Very Bad for the U.S. Economy
SUMMARY: If Congress fails to increase the government’s borrowing limit in time, the result would be a shock to the economy and financial markets.

TITLE: Twitter Said to Consider Selling User Names to Boost Revenue
SUMMARY: The company has discussed selling some user names through online auctions, people with knowledge of the plans said.

TITLE: Fed President Backs Slowdown as Support Mounts for Smaller Rate Move
SUMMARY: Susan M. Collins, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston, said she was leaning toward a quarter-point move at the central bank’s Feb. 1 meeting.

TITLE: Rebecca Blumenstein, a Senior Times Editor, Takes a Top Role at NBC News
SUMMARY: The appointment of Ms. Blumenstein, a deputy managing editor at The Times, is a part of a broad overhaul of the news division at NBCUniversal.

TITLE: Thousands of Airline Passengers Affected by FAA System Outage
SUMMARY: Fliers stranded by an F.A.A. system failure on Wednesday commended pilots and staff even as passenger advocates called the shutdown “shocking” and potentially avoidable.

TITLE: R.J. Reynolds Pivots to New Cigarette Pitches as Flavor Ban Takes Effect
SUMMARY: Now that California’s tobacco prohibitions are in place, some Camel and Newport items are billed as newly “fresh” or “crisp” non-menthol versions.

TITLE: LVMH Shuffles Leadership at Dior and Louis Vuitton, Its Top Brands
SUMMARY: The company’s chairman, Bernard Arnault, continues to promote his children to the luxury goods group’s key posts.

TITLE: I.R.S. Backlogs Continue as Republicans Mount Offensive
SUMMARY: The National Taxpayer Advocate expressed hope that better days were ahead for the tax collection agency.
